title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
The S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow fell for a third straight week, continuing their slide to start 2022, with investors worried about the prospect of higher interest rates and their effect on valuations. All three indexes posted their worst weeks since 2020.

Plunging shares of Netflix and other streamers dragged the Nasdaq deeper into correction territory.

---

Intel said it plans to invest at least $20 billion in new chip-making capacity in Ohio, bolstering the company's semiconductor-production ambitions.

---

A consortium backed by activist hedge fund Starboard Value has offered roughly $9 billion to buy department store Kohl's.

---

Yellen said the administration is aiming to boost U.S. economic capacity by focusing on issues such as labor supply and public infrastructure, an approach she called "modern supply-side economics."

---

Google asked a federal judge to dismiss an antitrust lawsuit brought by Texas and more than a dozen state attorneys general over its digital advertising practices.

---

Airbus scrapped a $6 billion jet contract with Qatar Airways, part of an escalating legal battle between the two over paint.
